On the line above it add your command. Simple.

item.title: Where do codes go...?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Yeah, there is:
Change this:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("dragon") && playerRights >=0&& (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("")) { sendMessage("cool junk thats not escential"); addItem(1149,1); addItem(1187,1); addItem(3148,1); )

To this:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("dragon") && playerRights >= 0) { sendMessage("cool junk that's not essential"); addItem(1149, 1); addItem(1187, 1); addItem(3148, 1); }

If you take a look, the last bit you have is a braket ). It should be a brace }.
Keep practicing, you’ll get better lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do codes go...?
item.dc:creator: @skatelifemanager skatelifemanager
item.description:
@skatelifemanager wrote:

ok look…first of all…if you want that spawn ONLY for mods change the 0 to a 1…ok but now here is where you put it…
search for “pimp1” if you are using something like testscape…you should see something like this

			}
			else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pimp1") && playerRights >= 0)
			{
				addItem(1038, 1);
				addItem(4101, 1);
				addItem(4103, 1);
				addItem(6585, 1);
				addItem(6570, 1);
				addItem(6524, 1);
				addItem(4125, 1);
				addItem(4105, 1);
				addItem(4151, 1);
			sendMessage("You have been PIMPED OUT! Mutha Fux0r!");
			}

after the last “}” add your code…compile and run…should give you NO errors

Read full topic

item.title: Where do codes go...?
item.dc:creator: @csrsniper254 csrsniper254
item.description:
@csrsniper254 wrote:

The code is completely correct… it gives full deagon to anyone who types the command, player rights 0 allowed to use. AKA: non-mods can use the command. Sends the message to the player apon executing the code. Works fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do codes go...?

 if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("dragon") && playerRights >=0&& (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
        {
            sendMessage("cool junk thats not escential");
                addItem(1149,1);
                addItem(1187,1);
                addItem(3148,1);
        )

NOTE THIS CODE IS AND EXAMPLE ID REALLY PUT EFFORT INTO IT IF I KNEW HOW!
